Checks whether the index contains records of a given table alias.

Specified by:
containsRecordsOfTableAlias in class IndexEventHandler
Parameters:
tableAlias - the table alias
Returns:
true if the index contains records of the given table alias, otherwise false

newIndexUpdateContext

public final IIndexUpdateContext newIndexUpdateContext(de.tif.jacob.core.Context context,
                                                       de.tif.jacob.core.data.impl.index.IndexDataSource dataSource)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a new index update context which is needed especially when an index is (incrementally) updated and (re)build.

Specified by:
newIndexUpdateContext in class IndexEventHandler
Parameters:
context - the applications current context
dataSource - the index data source
Returns:
a new index update context
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any severe problem
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if updating of an index is not supported in the corresponding application. This might be the case for two different applications sharing the same index, i.e. the one application just reading the index (reconfigure flag = none) should throw this exception.

addToContentsField

public boolean addToContentsField(de.tif.jacob.core.Context context,
                                  ITableAlias alias,
                                  ITableField field)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Checks whether values of the given table field should be added as content (see CONTENTS_FIELD) for data table records of the given alias to the index.

The default implementation of this method returns true for every text, long text (excluding history fields) and document field. In all other cases false is returned.

Parameters:
context - the current application context
alias - the table alias
field - the table field
Returns:
true if values of the given table field should be added to the index, otherwise false
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any problem
See Also:
CONTENTS_FIELD

getContentsFieldBoost

public float getContentsFieldBoost(de.tif.jacob.core.Context context,
                                   ITableAlias alias,
                                   ITableField field)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the boost factor for values of the given table field when added as content (see CONTENTS_FIELD) for data table records of the given alias to the index.

The default implementation of this method returns 1.0f for each table field. To boost certain table field, a factor of greater 1 should be returned.

Parameters:
context - the current application context
alias - the table alias
field - the table field
Returns:
the boost factor of the given table field
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any problem
See Also:
CONTENTS_FIELD

getContentType

public java.lang.String getContentType(de.tif.jacob.core.Context context,
                                       ITableAlias alias,
                                       ITableField field)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the content type of the given table field.

Example: If this method returns text/html, the table field values will be HTML parsed to only added the real content to the index, i.e. skipping any HTML tags.

The default implementation of this method always returns text/plain. Which means that the content is not parsed, i.e. the content will be completely indexed.

Note: This method will only be invoked for text fields, i.e. fields of type TextFieldType!

Parameters:
context - the current application context
alias - the table alias
field - the table field
Returns:
the content type or null to try to automatically detect content type
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any problem

getSubjectFieldValue

public java.lang.String getSubjectFieldValue(de.tif.jacob.core.Context context,
                                             IDataTableRecord record)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the subject string of the given data table record, which will be added as SUBJECT_FIELD field to the index.

The default implementation of this method returns the string presentation of the representative field of the corresponding table definition (see ITableDefinition.getRepresentativeField()) or null, if no representative field exists for that table.

The subject string should give the user an idea about which data entity has been retrieved from an index in a human understandable manner.

Parameters:
context - the current application context
record - the data table record
Returns:
the subject string of the given data table record or null
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any problem

getCategoryFieldValue

public java.lang.String getCategoryFieldValue(de.tif.jacob.core.Context context,
                                              IDataTableRecord record)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the category string of the given data table record, which will be added as CATEGORY_FIELD field to the index.

The default implementation of this method always returns null, i.e. category feature not available by default.

Parameters:
context - the current application context
record - the data table record
Returns:
the category string of the given data table record or null
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any problem

getMatchingTableFields

public final java.util.Set getMatchingTableFields(IDataRecord indexRecord)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Determines the table fields of the referenced table record (see IndexEventHandler.getReferencedTableRecord(IDataRecord)), which have been added to an index datasource and are responsible that the given index record has been retrieved.

Specified by:
getMatchingTableFields in class IndexEventHandler
Parameters:
indexRecord - the index record, which results from a search on an index data source
Returns:
Set of ITableField
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on any problem in case the matching table fields can not be determined

getReferencedTableRecord

public final IDataTableRecord getReferencedTableRecord(IDataRecord indexRecord)
                                                throws RecordNotFoundException
Determines the data table record, which is referenced by an index record.

Note: The returned record is the record (at least the one with the same primary key value), which has been originally added to the index by means of IIndexUpdateContext.addToIndex(IDataTableRecord).

Specified by:
getReferencedTableRecord in class IndexEventHandler
Parameters:
indexRecord - the index record, which results from a search on an index data source
Returns:
the referenced record
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - in case the referenced record can not be retrieved anymore
